comment: She really is the best! You get great feedback and she really wants you to learn. You leave her class better off than you started.
Super kind and patient! You will definitely learn in her class. Great feedback.
Wow just wow. This woman thrives off of making her students suffer. If you take her get ready to not know what is happening and have copious amounts of work that you won't finish. Good luck.

Unorganized and ridiculous. The work for this class isn't difficult, just unnecessarily time consuming (hours more than my math and bio classes combined) and often irrelevant to the actual subject. She requires you to write, illustrate and print (on your own time and dime) a book to donate to her charity. Don't take; an easy subject made miserable

This prof's  inability to properly plan and schedule course work is maddening.  Assignments are very lumpy--30 mins one day, many hours the next--and often poorly communicated.    After killing yourself to complete a paper on time,  she might extend the due date.   She will make you understand and love African culture, though.  Might be worth it.

1st of all, very rude. Unorganized and unclear.Gave us hard assignments at the very last minute:not giving us time to prepare.she made me hate French.She was very rude to the students, instead of helping them, she would criticize. Warning!Dont take!The assignments were useless and stupid. She teaches at a highschool level, with participation sheets

Unorganized!AVOID at all costs! If she doesn't like u, she will definitely show it through rude comments & awful facial expressions. She wants u to be exactly like her. If u don't say/write what she thinks is best, then ur grade will reflect.Creativity/opinions constricted bc she is a CONTROL FREAK. Unrealistic work load. Bully,intimidator, etc

Teaches 100% orally and tests 90% by writing. Her idea of teaching is to stare at a student until French words corporealize in their heads. Often does not understand the essentials of what you're telling her in English. Proof that a Doctorate in Language is not a Dr. in Education.
Very good teacher. Her accent can be a little hard to understand at first, but I'd certainly recommend her for 1001. Cares about her students and is very willing to offer individual help.
Tests were fairly easy, plenty of grades. I don't think she is a good or a bad teacher. Class was fun.

While it's true that she is a hard teacher, she means well. To sum up her class, there's a lot of writing involved & a lot of literature analysis. I can't emphasize the importance of having an opinion about what you read & backing it up with evidence. It's a touch class, but do the work and show up on time & you should be fine.
Not recommended at all to any students.
